Reviews.Title: “View to be seen”
Reviews.Author: agnes j
Reviews.Content: It was my first time visiting an econ o lodge and it was a great experience and one to be visited again . Felt like a 5 star resort and someone really took the time to make you feel wanted there no hidden message or mistakes in all the people coming and going. I was very impress with the front staff and would recommend this to anyone who wants a great quality motel

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was excellent, manager extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: jeffemmett
Reviews.Content: Manager Toni seems set to right some of the wrongs committed by the past owners. Rooms were clean and front desk was helpful, Toni even went the extra mile to have breakfast above and beyond the usual continental, even offering us fruit the night before because none would be available at breakfast. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Darryl26144
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Econolodge in mid-November. I hadn't read any of the reviews on here prior so I didn't have any preconcieved ideas. The price was the main appeal. I found the staff at reception were friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, clean and had a huge bed. I wasn't expecting luxury, but something simple and comfortable. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and found everything fine. There is a bit of noise in the area, but I expected this given its downtown location. Sadly, after I left, the security deposit of $150 was still on my credit card and it had not come off automatically as it should have -in the end a staff error. This made me quite anxious so I contacted the hotel and spoke with Toni, she had just started that week as the new manager. Toni was reassuring and after explaining my situation, providing some proof of the problem, she rectified the problem straight away - reversing the transaction while I was on the phone with her. Given her approach, I am really confident Toni will raise the performance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service was the deciding factor”
Reviews.Author: rob w
Reviews.Content: The new manager Toni was extremely helpful. She she was brand new to this operation but had 30 yrs. of hotel experience and was determined to correct some of the issues the previous manager had not. She was very informative and help us resolve a parking problem. She told us not to hesitate to tell her if there were any concerns we had and she would address them and if we had any problems with the room she would be happy to move us. We had no problems with the room and it was clean and quiet. We needed more pillows and they were delivered pronto. we had problems with our room key and both she and Aala came to the room and sorted it out right away for us. We have no problem in recommending this hotel especially at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all for the price”
Reviews.Author: susan b
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was good rooms were clean and great location.except no parking garage no frills stay and easy access to old Montreal and and restaurants not far from Ste Catherine street and easy walk to the Metro station. Manager Giovanni and the front desk were very helpful in answering any of our questions. I'm not sure why people say the hotel isn't nice for the price not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CDOTR
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews here before booking this hotel. I would have chosen someplace else. The hotel is located a bit off the beaten path, there are other hotels that are in the same price range (or a little higher) which are in far better locations. It was fairly close to the Metro (subway) station which we used. Upon arrival we found the room unique in shape, and small in size; but it was also noisy. There was a lot of street noise. We found this all night, and even the next day. We went about our business and did what we wanted to do. When we returned to the hotel we found that the window had been left open. Thus all the street noise and the fact that the air conditioner would not shut-off. The door to the room had an inch to inch and a half gap underneath it. The bathroom was ok; the tub was a little tired and worn. The clock radio was not plugged in on the bedside table. So, I had to plug it in and then figure out how to set the time. The walls were not clean in one area of the room. The breakfast consisted of bread, plain or toasted was your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel & customer service I have ever recieved!!!”
Reviews.Author: trickytrina80
Reviews.Content: Do NOT ever stay here!! The only reason we did not change hotels was because we got a employee discount through choice hotels and paid $35 a night. I have never had a worse experience trying to check into a hotel in my life!! The customer service from the manager Giovanni was horrible. We had checked in on thursday and confirmed that we had a second room booked for the Sat night @ $35, we had friends coming, nd they assured us they did. When they tried to check in they tried to charge them $189 and then told me the the reservation was cancelled and the hotel was full!! But they had a room a few seconds prior if they wanted to pay $189!! He was a complete IDIOT!! After 30 min of arguing he finally gave us the room at the proper rate after finally checking my reservation #. The rooms are GROSS!! stains on the carpets, dirty bathrooms & the rooms smell. I've stayed in better hostels. Do yourself a favour and don't EVER stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Allcountry001
Reviews.Content: Ok so let me start of by saying that I wish I had read the reviews on here before I booked it! I've been staying in Choice Hotel`s all over Canada and the US for a number of years and have always found they to be good for the price, clean and with friendly staff. This hotel reminded me of one of those dive motels that would rent rooms by the hour!!! It was absolutely horrible. We stayed at the hotel one night, Friday to Saturday. There was a huge music festival and comedy festival in the city that night so all the hotels were completely booked, or we would have switched hotels. I could write on for days everything that was wrong with the hotel room but I`ll give a point form list instead. - we were on the main floor with curtains that would not close -our windows did not open -we had no AC in our room and it was 30 degrees in Montreal that day, it was far too hot for comfort with no airflow -We complained and asked to change rooms and they told us that they would bring us a fan -When they brought the fan it had dirt and hair tangled and stuck all through it, not to mention the housekeeper told us that the room was never used because it was too hot! -The front desk staff were rude, had horrible customer service and were very disrespectful -The bathroom was the most dirty bathroom I have ever been in and I have traveled to Cuba, the Dominican Republic and all over Canada and the US - The fan in the bathroom did not work Now I did call Choice Hotels when we first got in the room and our complaints to the front desk got us no where. The rep was extremely helpful, called the hotel numerous times trying to sort everything out and the front desk individual refused to speak English to him, even though he would speak English to us fine.... The rep ensured me that they would take care of this and the owners would face serious consequences for such a horrible experience to repeat customers... lets hope they follow through!

Reviews.Title: “never stay here...shady staff and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: adventure83
Reviews.Content: I heard this hotel was a budget hotel but wanted to try it out anyway. At the start they photocopied my ID. At all the hotels I've been too I've never had my ID photocopied, somtimes some hotels would check it to make sure you're the person that booked the hotel. In the room it smelled like pee in the corners and lovely pubic hair on the ice bucket. Checking out I thought I'd ask for the photcopy they made of my ID. They said they keep it for records and because it's a bad area (the area is ghetto like) I said that can be used for identity fraud, it's happened to friends. They said to talk with the manager who doesn't usually come by. Are you kidding me. All it takes is one disgruntled employee years later and goes into the records and steals your identity. Never stay at such hotels, I was a fool for giving it a chance, don't let it happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you just need a place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: SunnyPsyOp
Reviews.Content: Come into the hotel knowing that you get what you pay for, and it's not so bad; especially if you're not planning to spend the day in your room. One bad point is that the hotel itself is in kind of a sketchy area that extends for two or three blocks around the place. Depending on where your room is, you may have homeless people living right outside your window. Several days in a row I saw cars with smashed out windows parked outside the place (There's no free parking here, and you'll have to be lucky to get a place on the street anywhere close). On the upside, there didn't seem to be any real danger. You're pretty close to both Rue Sherbrooke and St. Catherine's Street here, and there's plenty of people. The hotel is near the Places-Des-Arts mÃ©tro station, and there's plenty of nightlife in the area. As for the rooms themselves, it's bare-bones. They basically give you beds, a TV, some towels, and that's it. But if you're not expecting a whole lot, one can make do.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: baroque-quest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over the USA and Europe and this is, by far, the worst hotel experience in my life. As others noted, the place stinks; it might be urine, booze, milk, or something I'd rather not think about dropped by former clients. The entire place is shabby and unattractive. Breakfast was OJ, coffee, and some cheap bread. I stayed for two nights and the maid never bothered to clean my room. The bathroom was the dirtiest I've ever seen. The hotel seems to cater to large, rude groups. I was just trying to get to sleep on my second night when the riot started. A bus disgorged a large group of late-teens / early-20s. They spent the entire night partying -- some with their room doors propped open to allow everyone else to hear their noise, with other doors being constantly opened and slammed shut -- and running up and down the stairs going somewhere else. I complained to the manager, but he could not give a rip. It was obvious that the large group's revenue was more important to him than worrying about whether his hotel's ambiance was worse than that of a college dorm during a floor party. The manager would not intervene with his rude guests, not would he adjust my room bill to account for the fact that I got no sleep that night. I checked-out and left the hotel at around 6 AM just to escape. The location was marginal, with drunks and other losers drifting merrily nearby. Comparing it to cities like Chicago, it was tame, but compared to Ottawa it was a dump. The only saving grace is that it is close to a metro station. Don't stay here, even if it is free.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, cheap hotel in downtown Montreal - repeat customers”
Reviews.Author: ebonytoronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not fancy , cheap and close to the metro which is a huge perk. We got a good deal on expedia for 10 nights so did not mind the crappy rooms. They are pretty crappy. But, we were out all day long, and were willing to be central for a good price. The Italian manager is quite a personality, and nice enough to the guests. He tells you the way it is: the truth. So I liked getting his advice.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive !! Horrible”
Reviews.Author: creewinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is poorly kept & old. The hotel room smelt of urine (in the carpet?). The staff were not courteous. The car needed to be parked 2 blocks off site and paid extra. I felt unsafe in this area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Horrible Smelled Like Urine!”
Reviews.Author: synnamin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting! The halls smelled of urine and there was a homeless person sleeping in a box outside our window. They would not refund our money even though we were only there 30 min and during that time changed rooms. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “So not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: wildecat666
Reviews.Content: This has been the most dissatisfying, frustrating, service-lacking stay in all our travel experiences. This place lacked even the most basic level of service, and the staff were rude, discourteous, and full of attitude. Rooms were shabby; one of ours still had dirty towels (and a dirty t-shirt) left by the previous guest, which were not removed until 2 days into our stay, despite being dumped on the floor. They was also no wardrobe or rack - absolutely nowhere to hang up clothes or coats. One of our rooms had a locked minibar (which we wanted to use as a fridge), but no key. The front desk clerk explained that the previous guest must have taken the key, and that he would notify the manager. 24 hours later, we still had no key and, upon inquiry, were informed that it was our job to track down the manager and let him know we wished the minibar unlocked, as the manager will not 'bother us' in case we did not wish 'to be disturbed.' The wireless internet, which was supposed to have been provided, did not work a single day of our 5-day stay. When we inquired on the first day when it would be fixed, we were told told by the front desk clerk that he "does not know," which was also the answer to our inquiry as to whether they were expecting a tech anytime soon. When we asked about the wireless internet again on the last day (a couple of hours before check-out - idle curiosity), we were told the same thing. If you want to have your room cleaned past noon, forget it - housekeeping does not work after 12pm, despite the fact that noon is the official check-out time. Continental breakfast is a joke - upon coming down to the lobby, one must tell the front desk the number of people in the party, and each person will be allocated two small croissants; no more. On days when there are no croissants, guests have to do with Wonderbread. On the bright side, Wonderbread dosage is not regulated, and there is a toaster that comes with. Coffee is available all day long, but cups are not (if they were, we never saw them!); it is bring-your-own for that midday caffeine infusion. And all that is in addition to the fact that, despite being conveniently located in the center of the city, this Econolodge is actually on a rather sketchy, unpleasantly stinky street. In our experience? Take your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of terrible cancellation policy. It cost me $400!”
Reviews.Author: VermontBill
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in early February, 2010, for four nights to attend a Rotary convention in Montreal. My plans changed and I called to cancel in April. they said to look at my confirmation- it stated I had to cancel or change by March 22, 2010. This was 90 days before I was to arrive! I have never heard of such an unfair policy. I called the manager who was unwavering, then I called Choice Hotels, and they said they could do nothing, that each manager is independent. I would recommend avoiding Econo Lodge and any Choice Hotel if this is the way they treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: “the only really good thing is their great location (close to St. Laurent), but the service is not worse the money”
Reviews.Author: OnkelPhil123
Reviews.Content: When i arrived 20 minutes befor check-in time in this hotel in Rue St.Dominique @ St Norbert the frontdesk staff told me without greeting that I'd have to line up and wait until 3pm. He didn't even try to find me clean a room so that I had to wait with about 5 other people till he started checkin us in at 3 sharp! He didn't show any interest in my plans, problems and he has no interest in answering my questions about the area, stores and a laundromat. Furthermore the Frontdeskagent came into my room, without knocking, because he wanted to "check" it - whatever that mean! The "Bright Starts" continental breakfast consists of coffee, juice and old-dry croissants! If they have enough of them it isn't worth the try, no jam, no cereals and nothing fresh... It's one of the worst breakfasts I ever had, even a youth hostel serves better staff! The rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff seems to do a proper job (they are the only one who really cared about my requests)! The best thing is the location, close to Rue St. Laurent where a big part of the Montreal's Nightlife takes place and you can find a great meal 24/7! One of those things could be tolerated, but all in all it's not a nice place to stay, espacially if you are travelling on a budget that forces you to eat those croissants...

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST”
Reviews.Author: MEC_10
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel anywhere in the world worse then this place. The staff were the most unfriendly,unhelpfull people I have ever encountered. Ask them for an early check in over the phone....they immediatly said No and too bad. Asked If we could keep out bags there while we attended the hockey game...im told "ya sure, in a room that is unsafe and anyone can enter". Get into the room and it stinks very musty and is just as plain as the bagel I had for breakfast. The hotel itself is surrounded by awefullness. Garbage and homeless people surrounding both side of the building on top of the 2 past out drug junkies litterally right outside the doors. I thought they were dead and had to ask someone outside to double check. 3 of the most common things I asked for and were denied all 3..and extra ice bucket to prevent from mutiple trips downstaitrs..NO. an extra pillow for my pregnant wife..NO. ad last but not least........a friggin Map of the area. NO. how can any hotel not provide any 1 of these things is so beyond me. Last but not least, they "required" a $100 downposit when checking in...I can understand that..but when we go to check out in the morning...No one in the place knows how to return my deposit onto my debit card !! I end up leaving the city with the promise that "someone will be in shortly and they will do the return then call me". well 8 hours later and now back in my home city..the money is not there yet, so I call them. After about 9 attempts to call the front desk, I finally get through. Tell the guy my story of this morning, and he has the nerve to tell me first that " I must not have came to the front desk to check out "!!!!! After I make it clear that I certainly did check out correctly he tells me to "calm down and lower my voice". So he tries to return my desposit and guess what.......he dont know how to do it either. So he tells me to wait till tomorrow and a manager will call me. I have a real feeling this call will not come. I dont care if this hotel charged $10 a night for a room...I would NEVER stay there again....and I really hope you do yourself a favor and dont either

Reviews.Title: “JUST HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryApplejuice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night 2 years ago and still cant get fully recovered from this horrible experience. The other reviewer is telling 100% the truth about the bedbugs!!! My mom woke up in the middle of the night feeling incredibly ichy and found out she got bed bug bites all over her face and arms. After turning on the light we literally saw 2 bed bugs creeping on the sheet!!!! How disgusting is that!!!! We had to pack up our stuff right away and checked out at 2am wandering on the street looking for a place to stay for the night. The hotel staff especially the manager was rude pretending they know nothing about this "OCCURANCE" at all. Thanks god we finally got our money back. JUST DONT STAY HERE EVERYONE!!! This is simply a gross place...worst hotel on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hIghlandpark27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I can't say enough about this hotel Charming, low-key exceptional service. Staff polite, room was surprisingly large spacious beautiful bathroom The heat in our room was a bit hard to control, and we often felt too warm, but it wasn't a big problem at all .This hotel was well located with many good restaurants within a short walk metro is nearby. Overall, we were very happy with our stayed and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: zoeooz
Reviews.Content: At first the neighborhood seems a bit seedy but it was perfectly safe .The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful polite and acomodating our room was spacey and it had a mini cooler kept our beer nice and cold night life is only a 5min walk.The only two negitive things was the parking $20 a night and it was outside parking and the other negitive thing was the heater it was a bit noisy but beside this not bad at all it was very convenient for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Just like everyone else says, this place is worthless”
Reviews.Author: travelallucan
Reviews.Content: I'm just going to throw my 2 cents in here and echo the overwhelming sentiment here: this place is just plain awful, one of the worst hotel experiences I've had in my life. Subpar rooms, amenities, service, and worst of all, management. Trust me and everyone else on here: don't do it. Blech.

Reviews.Title: “Econo Lodge Is A Disgusting Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BritishColumbiaBeans
Reviews.Content: If you're going to book this hotel, ALWAYS book it through CHOICEHOTELS.COM , NOT directly through the hotel, you have a better chance of getting your money back in case you change your mind, which you will once you actually see it. We originally booked for 4 nights and wound up staying only 1 night because it was so disgusting. The hotel was located in a sketchy area. The manager Gianni, and the hotel staff were rude, made up arbitrary rules (we were told to pay a $100 deposit, another woman was told to pay a $50 cash deposit and when she asked for a receipt, the staff member wrote it down on a random piece of paper) and provided horrible service. The room was disgusting (check out the photos). This hotel is not a hotel, it is more like a HOSTEL. The bathtub was filthy when we arrived. Then when we wanted to check out the manager Gianni, who pretended he was someone else when we called down to complain, told us that we couldn't get our money back because we had to cancel 48 hours in advance. Then when we asked to see his cancellation policy for patrons who cancel after 48 hours, he said that he didn't have one written down! Needless to say we argued and got the money back for the 3 nights we cancelled. This place is absolute filth! If you don't believe me, read some of the other reviews about this hotel. DISGUSTING! But on another note, instead of complaining and offering no alternative, here's a great place you can stay. If you're looking for a fantastic place in Montreal with a fantastic price and location you should go the Le 1 Rene Levesque. Great service, great rates (especially if you're a AAA or CAA member), nice room, housekeeping, internet access and computers, laundry room, kitchen, microwave and sink in your suite. You name it, it was excellent. Check it out at: http://le1renelevesque.com/index.php?lang=en

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Mehr0028
Reviews.Content: Contrary to most comments here I did not find bedbugs in my bed (nor any other critters elsewhere) and I found the room to be relatively clean. It did'nt smell funny or have stains all over the place. Sure it was a little run down, but what do you expect for less than $100 a night. I don't know if I was lucky or management actually corrected their bedbug problem that other patrons have commented about here. The breakfast was garbage; just stale croissants, burnt coffee. Just sleep in and go have breakfast out when you wake up. The location was'nt as bad as I thought it would be after having read the comments. After all it is downtown and I would recommend walking along Sherbrooke rather than St. Catherines or the southern streets if you want to avoid the homeless people and the strip bars in that area. But the first night we found ourselves in that neighborhood and it was no big deal. If you have a car I recommend parking in the complex on Jean Manse and Rene Levesqe because its the same price as the hotel's and it has security and underground parking. I paid $19 per day. One of the guys at the hotel was really helpful and he gave me a map and told me where the attractions were. The others were helpful but not as enthusiastic. Overall it was an enjoyable stay on a budget. I got exactly what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GGSTU
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel that is clean and in walking distance (20 min) to most of the sites in montreal. There is no parking in the hotel but I parked at the Library underground parking 10 mins away for $7 for 24 hrs (weekend rate). There is also complimentary continental breakfast. We had a single double bed room that was clean, shower / tv / wireless internet / AC work fine. The room comes with an ironing board and iron, a fridge is also in the room (but was not plugged in - you can plug it in if you want to use it). The hotel is in an old building but the neighborhood is quiet and we did not hear anything from the other rooms. Contrary to the other reviews we did not have any bed bugs in our bed, however there were some bums up the street when we were walking back at night time - but they did not bother us. Overall it is a budget hotel and if you don't mind it being a bit rough around the edges it's a good location for a budget price. I would recommend staying here if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD Location”
Reviews.Author: wonder_9
Reviews.Content: located near nite life and was a good for the price The hotel is right downtown near metro you can take a cab for little money. The staff were extremely accomodating and funny . When I asked to switch rooms on my second nite do to heating problem clerk was very helpful. For the price of the location you can not complain. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again-Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto
Reviews.Content: The property could be nice for its scale, but the management makes it less than desirable. The check-in is less than welcoming and the entire service throughout the stay is horrible. The front desk treats you as if you were invisible, never acknowledging you at all. The night time person would rather watch YouTube than even look up to shed a glance or even attempt to say hello. You have to use a key to get in the property every time, so you think the click of the door would arouse a simple hello. Not at this property. They don't care. The property also has this extremely outdated electronic key system that enables you to unknowingly double lock yourself out of your own room. I had to get the front desk guy to open the door again for me. I have been in 100s of hotels and motels in my lifetime and I have never seen a more irrational lock system than this one. The property uses a very cheap cleaning material in the hallways which makes your senses turn. The breakfast, albeit free, consists of dry croissants, butter and jam. It looks extremely unappetizing. This place is to be avoided unless you are strapped on cash. It is unwelcoming and unfitting for a pleasant Montreal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep tight - Don't let the bedbugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: fotogurl13
Reviews.Content: I went with a couple of girlfriends for the weekend and did not personlly book the hotel. We arrived at the hotel to find that it was situated in a sketchy area; On a hill; Parking was across the road with a crazy attendent who raised the price if you questioned it. Reminded me of a rundown apartment with by-the-hour clientele. Our room was okay enough to sleep in however as we got situated and decided on where to go next - I pulled out the pillow to hang on to and dicovered a BED BUG crawling on it...ewwww! So we took it to the night staff and asked to have new sheets - h eobliged and apologized. When we went back up to change the sheets I found more in between the sheets and cover - while do ing this - a huge commotion broke out in the hall and we thought someone was going to get hurt - so I called the Front Desk to mention it and he did not understand and came up and good thing as more bed bugs were crawling on the wall...so gross! He was able to find us another room for the night. We then proceeded to call Expedia to explain our situation and they told us either to stick it out or stay in our car for the rest of the night...so needless to say at 5am we layered on more clothing and slept on top of the sheets until the manager arrived the next morning...he was good about the whole ordeal. We will never stay there again nor will we book through Expedia again. We were told by the next hotel that Expedia may show you what you want, but process your request as "what ever is available" :(

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: Frolic1
Reviews.Content: On the spur of the moment, my husband and I decided to take a mini- vaction and drive from NYC to Montreal. On Tuesday, I checked Choicehotels.com and chose this hotel mainly for the location and price. We checked in the next day at 4PM for 2 nights; our room was ready, the gentleman at the desk spoke English, and yes, the hallway leaves a lot to be desired, but the room was better than we expected. (Yes, we know the difference in hotels: in July, we stayed at the Palazzo in Las Vegas for 6 nights and we'll be staying at the Grand Floridian in Orlando next week)) Anyway, the room was pretty large, and although I didn't walk aound barefoot, the linens were clean, the bathroom was clean, shower water pressure good and the TV and air conditioning worked. What more does anyone expect from a $100 per night chain hotel? We didn't want to leave our car on the street, so we found a parking lot around the block, and paid $15.00 per day. We never moved it, because we were able to walk to St. Denis for dinner, and the next day we walked to Chinatown and Old Montreal. After resting in the room for an hour, we even walked to the Old Forum (about 40 minute walk) to see a movie. We were on the first floor, and we didn't hear any noise, and slept just fine. So, it is what it is. An relatively inexpensive, clean hotel, right in the heart of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: rogeran
Reviews.Content: Little better than sleeping on the street. The worst hotel I ever seen in my life. I booked for two nights. The toilet was not working. OK fine they gave me another room. In the second room bathtub drain was blocked. Complained and they told me to move to another room. I said no and stayed in second room. No parking in the hotel. Paid and parked in the parking lot behind the hotel. $20.00 a night. Next morning my car was broken. Some stuff were stolen from the car. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is cheap”
Reviews.Author: kidmarine
Reviews.Content: It cost us only $79 a night and boy did we get what we paid for. LOCATION: Smack dab in the middle of the gay, dumpy village. Drug dealers, bums, and hookers are out at night so get inside before it hits 10pm. We got home at 10:30 and there was a drunk peeing on the sidewalk as our family walked by with our eyes glancing elsewhere. No parking at all. You WILL get a ticket. If you are from the USA like us, just don't pay the ticket and you'll be fine. ROOM: Small, average. No unique amenities. View of the parking lot. Paper thin walls. We heard babies crying and (I think) a husband hitting his wife. SERVICE: It's going to be tough booking your room unless you speak French. The desk isn't helpful because they didn't speak English. Good thing we booked online beforehand. OVERALL: We could've done better. If you are a really stingy, frugal person just splurge and spend $150 a night on a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this is the most ridiculous hotel !”
Reviews.Content: Actually I did not stay. Let me put in this way, today is June 4,2008, I booked a room for the coming weekend-----June7 ,2008 for my friends two weeks ago. Unfortunately, my friends cannot make it. They are not coming to Montreal, and according to what the receiptist said when I booked the room, any changed has to be made before48 hours the date u reserved, I called today to cancel the reservation. Obivously, it is ,more than 48 hours in advance. However, the boss told me I cannot cancel it , if I want to do any change, it has to be before 30 days. otherwise, they will charge customers for two night, and it has to be two nights, because it is the system. what kind system is that ! I told the boss that I already asked policy about make any change and cancellation, I am following the rules.His answer is "maybe u did not ask. The best the way is u come and stay, and use the room! Otherwise, u 'rstill being charged from ur creditcard. " ( Faint!) Moreover, he told me that all these rediculous policy are written on the internet, but I never find it . I surfed on the internet, and log to the page which he told me www. econologe.com, I found choicehotel, I called to make complaints, they told me that it is a 24 hours advance cancellation policy, but they still can not do anything , because the system is in the hotel. what can I do? I read all the reviews about this hotel, it is very obviouse that they just want to grab the money from customers' pokets with any chance they can find. Such a shame!

Reviews.Title: “4/10”
Reviews.Author: ashrau
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife along with another couple ended up at this place because we didn't advance book our trip. We looked at some other really nice places online, for a lot cheaper, but when we reached there, we learnt that there was no more rooms. So after trying out a couple of places, we ended up here. To begin with, I don't know how they renovated it. It was still very shabby. We reached there really early morning, at about 8 am, and check in wasn't until 9. The guy at the desk told us that he'll have to charge us extra for checking in early. We took two rooms for two nights. The guy at the desk told us that he'd charge us $70 a night and $20 for checking in early. I asked him what time check out was and he said at noon. So i asked him if he'd let us check out a bit late since we're paying extra $$ right now for like 1 hour, and he said sure, and told us we can check out at 3 pm. The day of the check out, we recieved a call at 11:30 reminding us that we have to check out at 12:00. So i went down to the reception to see what the problem was, and turned out it was a different guy, perhaps the manager. I explained to him how the other person (gave him name and all) had this agreement with us. And the manager told us that he doesn't care, according to rules, we have to be out by 12, otherwise he'll charge us extra. After realizing he wasn't willing to listen, i asked him to give us some more time to pack our stuff. He said 12:30. So we were out by 12:30. Now the hotel. Dirty carpets, scary hallways, dirty washrooms, dirty and smelly bed covers. Rooms were nice sized tho, have to give them that. But the overall look of the hotel and the LOCATION, is very depressing. Made me and my wife miss home very much, which is really not what you want out of an outing. There was not enough parking (only street infront of hotel) but we were lucky enough to find a spot on both days n didnt get ny tickets. My advice, if you book early, you will be able to get much better hotels (non-chain types) for much less. We found that out first hand when we went to these couple of really cheap places first and discovered them to be extremely nice and classy, but no rooms. If its just a few guys hanging out, this will do. But even guys can do better if they book in advance! P.S Our room was a kind bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy for middle age couple”
Reviews.Author: RolandS
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights March 21-23. The first night in room 308 had 2 bad lamp bulbs (we got spares at the lobby and fixed it) and later we found a non-working heater. The hotel was full and we could not change room, so we stayed in the colder room one night. Everything was working well in the second room #208. However, the bigger issue is the noise at night. This is party central in Montreal and a lot of young people stay there for the W-E, so expect to hear doors clapping and people talking loud in the hallway and in adjacent rooms from 1 am till 4 am. This happened both nights on both floors. This was definitely a poor choice for my wife and I (middle age folks) who were looking for some rest after busy days visiting this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: TabithaTan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is infested with bedbugs. We had bugs in our first room; asked to be moved. Our second room also had bugs; management did not suggest another move, presumably because there are no bug-free rooms. When we spoke to the manager the next day, we were told we must have brought them (we came direct from our delightfully bug-free home in Ottawa). Having written that, there is no point writing anything else. There is no point writing about the lack of parking, about the surly service, about the filthy, overheated rooms. If you have not experienced bedbugs before, and relish the prospect of itchy welts, panic attacks and having to toss out your luggage and clothes, I strongly recommend a night or two in this premium establishment. I understand that there is a bedbug pandemic, but the way to dealing with it is not to ignore the problem and blame your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Poor security,m service”
Reviews.Author: nvh
Reviews.Content: When I checked out around 6 am on Sunday, there was no one at the desk (I rang and called out and waited about 15 minutes). The door to the outside (the one that can be opened with a room key) was propped open. While I was waiting, some people did come in from outside and head upstairs. Obviously, I got no bill. I left a note (on whatever scrap of paper I could find) asking that my bill be mailed to me. It never was. I phoned today and the man who answered offered to fax the bill to me. One evening during my stay, I ordered a take-out dinner to be delivered. The delivery man came straight to my room. No one called from the desk. Again, this is an unacceptable breach of security. Room was fine, but I will not stay there again and recommend that single women travelers, in particular, give this a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, public hair and broken fridge”
Reviews.Author: meena482
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gross! There were tiny bugs in the bathroom, public hairs in the bed sheets, and our fridge door was broken. I can understand it being worn out from age, but there is no excuse for dirtiness. On the other hand, the location was very handy to many exciting areas in Montreal. Very close to good shopping and lots of restuarants and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Worst!”
Reviews.Author: T1tan
Reviews.Content: First, I'm 70 years old, a retired U.S. Military veteran with over 22 years service, I worked for a major Industry for over 20 years after that. I've traveled extensively around the U.S., Europe and the U.K., Australia and Canada. First, the good points. Location was excellent for our purposes. We were within walking distance (even for me) to restaurants, the Jazz Festival, our venue (Metropolis), shops and other attractions. The room (Room 201), was very nice for the price (see caveats below). Amenities, such as, maid service, TV, Coffee, vending machines and ice were entirely acceptable and appreciated. The Complimentary breakfast was as we expected. Mostly, the staff was understanding of our requests. Second, the bad points. We arrived on Thursday July 5th, 2007 and stayed until the following Monday. After check-in, we proceeded to our room and couldn't find the safe. We had brought a substantial amount of American and Canadian cash for the four of us. We didn't want to walk the streets with this money nor leave it unprotected in our room. The duty clerk gave us a shrug as maybe our room didn't (or wasn't supposed to) have one. Also our request for a refrigerator again was met with a shrug. No one knew where the key was for the refrigerator. The next clerk didn't know either. The next morning we went to get a paper to do some Festival hunting. No papers. Again, shrugs (maybe they were all gone by the time we got there or not delivered). Only brochures were available. That morning our key cards became unusable on us. They didn't work and several times we were locked out of our room and we had to go down to the clerk to get into our room. This problem went on from Friday through Sunday afternoon when they mysteriously started working again. On Friday evening they gave us one "Master" card key from the Reception Desk. I though this was highly unusual. We didn't try this card on any other rooms, but I was uneasy just having a "Master Card Key". On Saturday, while we were lounging in our room, we were surprised by other guests opening our door and walking in on us (how did their key card work?). This was extremely unsettling for my wife and our grand daughter (as you might imagine). They wanted to leave immediately after that. Of course, the other guests apologized and went back to get another room. After the Key Card fiasco, the shift manager said that it was the "dead bolt" lock. But they were only able to duplicate the problem with the door open and the "dead bolt" turned out, not under any other circumstances. As a maintenance manager, with 50 years experience, I was highly skeptical of that explanation. The foregoing was just a prelude to our most grievous complaint. We rented a car to use on this trip. When we first arrived, we noticed that there were "No Parking" signs everywhere. When we inquired where we were supposed to park, we were told they didn't have any parking! Not in any description of the Lodging did I read that. We were directed to a parking lot a block away. The cost was to be $20.00 per day. When I got there I was told that the cost was $80.00 and the car would be parked for two days. I couldn't get it out until two days later! When I asked why, I was told that they didn't need my business and to "go away". I was also told that if I came back it would be $100.00 per night! Needless to say I was surprised that EconoLodge would recommend that parking lot as their parking lot. After two hours of driving around looking for a spot to park, I found one 4 blocks from the Econolodge. Three local persons couldn't tell me if the signs would allow me to park. It seems that there is NO parking under so many different reasons. The parking lots are few and far between in Montreal. The next morning I relayed my problems from the night before and the next clerk told me. "No, No, don't got to that lot, got to the College underground garage for $10.00 for 12 hours". I asked why I wasn't told that the night before, I got the usual shrug. So, after much concern and expense, I finally was able to park my rental car. Ultimately the total cost for parking was (at least) $90.00. I think I could have upgraded to a better hotel for that price! Also after closer inspection I noticed that some residents seemed to park on the street with no problem, whereas I was told the police would be called and I would be ticketed. In my opinion, I got ripped off using the Econolodge on this trip. Other hotels in this area have underground garages for patron parking. We spent absolutely too much for the Econolodge, gasoline, walking the streets too and from the parking lot and payment of $10.00 for partial 12 hour parking fees that all added up. I am also concerned that hotel management does not really care about customer service. If I were asked to recommend this hotel I definitely would NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Bed Bugs.”
Reviews.Author: Niblazed
Reviews.Content: Take the other guys advice and do not ever stay in this [--] hole, it was seriously the worst hotel I've ever had the misfortune of staying in. Upon arriving we checked in and went to our rooms. The first thing we noticed was it was NOT cleaned after the last people checked out. Both of the beds in our double were not made up, there was used napkins on the floor as well as dirty socks. So ok this was a very bad first impression. So I head downstairs and asked the guy at the desk if this hotel had any housekeeping, all I got was some weird looks. I then asked him for some clean shits and blankets and pillows, he returned with a few sheets and some towels. Ok so i guess we don't get blankets or pillows. Now after dealing with this we figured it couldn't get to much worse, but it sure did. Now we had a total of 6 people with us, so we got 2 double rooms. Our friends didn't arrive till a few hours later and when they did they seemed to have lucked out and got a room that was actually cleaned up. Lucky them they thought... till they woke up in the morning and noticed BED BUGS may have been feeding on them. I say may since there was blood on both beds sheets, but figuring how dirty this hotel is that may have already been there. Now this was just to much. We informed the front desk, and they're response to this was "You brought them from outside" I don't think they apologized at all. The only thing they did was refund the money for the 2nd night for the room that had the bugs. If everyone wanted to leave that grimey hotel we would not be refunded for the room that we didn't see bugs in (though they were probably there to). They would not give any type of refund for the first night, not even a partial. So whatever you do, no matter how budget your trying to make your trip, it is not worth it to stay in this room. The homeless shelters are probably cleaner then this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the effort”
Reviews.Author: JohnPenwarden
Reviews.Content: Booked through choicehotels.com. CH is the parent company for an entire host of hotels. The negative aspects of the hotel were many: 1. Parking was listed as $15/day offsite, however upon arrival, manager could not give accurate directions to parking lot and once found the price was $20/day and was several blocks away. 2. The deadbolt in the room door did not work. 3. The maid did not announce herself when she tried to enter (thank god for the door chain). 4. The bathroom was filthy, mold on the tiles, etc. 5. There was a whirlpool tub in the living room that had visible scum on it. 6. There was no "do not disturb sign" 7. There was no locking mechanism on the window and the window was close to the ground near a vacant lot. 8. Hotel has a 30 day minimum notice for cancellation. I wanted to used my membership points for a room in another hotel in the same chain, but the local manager would not release me from the room. I travel for a living and all other hotels I stay at allow a cancellation the same day of arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jayemwright
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed there. It is not the Hilton, but it is clean and safe. Check in and Check out were quick and friendly, room was basic, but clean, maid service was very good,. You can't beat the location. In between Stherbrooke and St. Catherines, as well as St. Denis and St. Laurent. Right in the heart of the action. The area around it is slightly run down, but that's Montreal. For the Jazz festival, you could probaly hear the music from your room! The location is that good-Especially for $58 USD per night. Here is a point form breakdown of the good and the bad... CONS: Parking-I got a ticket-$42 The Montreal parking police can be nasty- I don't think I was in the wrong, but the signs are in French, and I have been told that they prey upon non-Quebec cars. Pay the extra $15 per day and park on a lot. You will have to walk a bit though Breakfast-Not much-Croissants Orange juice and coffee. and they kept running out. but hey, it was free. PROS: Location, Location, Location- I noticed comments about being afraid in that neighbourhood. I have been going to Montreal for 30 years, all times of the year, day and night, and have never felt scared. Much of Montreal is a bit seedy, but that adds to the charm. This place was close to everything. Price-Almost half the cost of places half a mile away Check in and check out- fast, friendly efficient Room-Clean, and nice (for a cheap hotel) Free wireless internet A hotel in Monteal is a base of operaions: A place to sleep. This was fine for that purpose. If I want to hang out in a hotel room, I'll stay home. I like this piace for the easy access it offers to this wonderful city. .

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: aa27
Reviews.Content: Large room, clean, not noticed anything/anyone strange or dangerous nearby (normal environment, not particulary well-kept, of a big city). Walking distance from downtown, near metro. Stuff quite busy, but not unfriendly. Reasanoble (continental) brakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: McBeans
Reviews.Content: I decided to write this review for the Econolodge in downtown Montreal after reading other reviews that said they felt unsafe. The hotel is not great, but you should know that based on the price. It's a clean bed to sleep, that's all. I am from Toronto and felt no difference in terms of safety. Hookers smoking pot nearby doesn't really sound that dangerous to be honest. I am curious whether or not the people that said they did not feel safe actually experienced something to make them think this way. The staff at the hotel were fine and helpful when I asked for bus directions and taxi arrangements. It was in walking distance to many sites downtown, assuming you're used to an urban setting and the walking that accompanies it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: nb25
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. In an area of Montreal that didn't look safe to walk in. Unfriendly staff, not a pleasant experience. Room looked out onto an abandoned gravel lot with garbage in it. Parking was not mentioned to be a fee when booked. Couldn't park on the street (all restricted areas). Was initially told that parking was around the corner and in thru the wire fence. Couldn't locate parking so asked again to different person. Was then told parking was $15 and not provided by the hotel. Small unsecured lot. I was hoping that my car would still be there in the morning!!! Did not get accomodations I had made a reservation for. Reserved a king, got a queen. Shower curtain was tied back with a piece of toilet paper. Old mini-bar hidden in tv cabinet. Breakfast consisted of Croissants, juice and coffee. Better than nothing. Will never stay at an Econolodge again if this is what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, but not in a safe area”
Reviews.Author: tes300
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here to save a couple bucks rather than paying $150 a night to stay at a nicer hotel. If we could do it again, we'd pay the extra $$. There's no parking, and the lock on our room was broken. Now this made me feel a little insecure since on the cab ride there we witnessed two fights and a muggin right around the corner. Also, one of the nights we came back around midnight and there were two hookers sitting on the front steps smoking pot. No joke. One of our cab drivers said that there are alot of drug dealers in the area, so DO NOT go walking on the street late at night, for you are taking your life in your hands if you do. The room itself was clean and the staff was friendly, but the no parking and dangerous criminal activity in the area should be enough to keep you away.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here three times, have doubts if will again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good points - I was there for the Champcar Racing Weekend in August. As this location is two subway stops from the race track and maybe 3 subway stops from Cresent street were all the festivities are, its a great location. The price is very reasonable all in $450 cdn for four nights. Problems/Issues - One the Saturday Night an older lady started knocking my door around 7:30pm. I ignored her, surprise to me she opened my door lucky i had the emergency keychain lock on. She sreamed open the door. I closed it and got dressed when I opened she had disappeared. On the sunday Night the cleaning staff left my door not closed properly...anyone could have walked in. Everyday and night from the Thursday to sunday there were teenage/twentish young people on the pay phone on the floor all the time. Also lots of banging of doors at all hours. Other issue is that around St. Laurent station south to St. Catherine the area did not seem nice. I have been there two other times and although there were cleanliness and other problems their, this time there were many more and more extreme. I would not recommend the hotel at all for families with children. Overall i'm not sure if I will return to this hotel. I love the location and price, but the problems in the hotel and the st. laurent station/st. catherine area are probably to much for me to return.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy place”
Reviews.Author: littleshrub
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel which by the way is part way down a hill, the only parking there was, was on the street. Garbage was strewn around the area - I actually asked the gentleman at the registration desk (who by the way was very friendly) if it was safe to leave our car out on the street all night. We arrived at the hotel around 6:00ish and were only able to stay the one night. Our thought was that 'hey it's only one night' how bad can it be. The room was absolutely filthy. On the floor beside the bed were beer caps - approx. 5. There was garbage behind the night table. The floors did appear to be vacuumed at least. When I went to take a bath, only the shower worked as there was no plug for the tub. There were two double beds in the room - first thing I checked was to see if the sheets were clean, and they were. If I happened to get up in the dark I would have smacked by knee on the dresser to get to the door as there was just no room to move around. No place to put luggage. The hallways did smell. The rooms were dark and dingy. Upon checking out the next morning registration desk asked how was your stay - I mentioned the state of the room and can quote her response of "oh sorry!" All of this for $100.00 a night!!!!!!!! The real unfortunate part of this whole story - I read the reviews for this hotel AFTER our trip. I am so sorry I did not take the time to read the reviews before.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff were polite and helpful, the location was great, and the continental breakfast was free. The catch was that the room was smelly and so dirty that you could see grime on the walls. The hallway and room also smelled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the manager, "Jerry" with a handshake and a warm welcome. Our internet reservation was ready to sign when we arrived. Jerry let us use his parking spot right outside the door. Our room on the main floor as requested, was clean and well appointed with a comfortable mattress and great shower being one of the best Econolodges we have stayed in. We were within a 10 minute walk to old Montreal. In the morning we had a continental breakfast with other apparently very satisfied travellers. It was an extremely pleasant stay and we would definitely stay here again. Thanks to Jerry and all staff for making our stay very enjoyable and convenient. P.S. Jerry, let me know that you got this message. Doug

Reviews.Title: “Used to be ok, now run down!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed here numerous times, as we like the location (although it is on a very steep hill-not for the physically challenged) and the price. Unfortunately, over time the place has gotten rather run-down and grimy (hallways & rooms), and seems ever-populated by swarms of young adults who like slamming doors in the wee hours. The price no longer seems worth the ick factor--and with so many other nice places to stay in Montreal (namely, b&bs), we won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “looks run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the place was rundown with homeless people laying around outside. prison gates was on the windowof the first floor. it looked like a prison it's also built on a hill. i had to cancel my reservations and check in to the holiday inn. the holiday inn is a 100x better.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Econolodge for one night last May and was not impressed. For $100 a night, the room smelled moldy and the corridors smelled like...I can't even explain it...kind of like rotting sausages cooking in a vat of old grease. The service was awful. Parking was three blocks away. Never again.

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 2060 rue St-Dominique, Montreal, Quebec H2X 2X1, Canada
